claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote directly supports the claim by stating that Flublok (RIV4) is not subject to mutations that occur in egg-based vaccines, which can alter the antigenic match to WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains. This implies that Flublok maintains the intended antigenic match.

rejected_evidence.quote: Standard Dose Flu zone and FlucelVax. HD-IIV4 was High Dose Flu zone, RIV4 was Flublok and Adj-IV was FluAd.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote clarifies that RIV4 refers to Flublok, establishing the identity of the vaccine being discussed in the context of antigenic match and manufacturing method.
